intro: Breynia acuminata, commonly known as the firetree or red tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red, fleshy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy soils. Breynia acuminata is known for its ability to tolerate salt spray, making it a common species in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable ornamental and ecological plant.
